definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: breathe, blow ([[כור נפוח]] Sir 43:4 a furnace blown upon (heated hot); NH [[נׇפַח]] id., Targum [[נְפַח]], Syr. npah.; As. napâḫu, inflame, nappaḫu, smith Dl:HWB 474; Ar. (nafah.a and) nafaxa blow; Eth. nafx: or nafh.a: Di:712);—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pf. 3 fs. [[נׇֽפְחָה]] Je 15:9; [[וְנׇפַ֫חְתִּי]] Hag 1:9; [[וְנׇפַחְתִּ֫י]] Ez Eze 22:21; Impf. [[וַיִּפַּח]] Ge 2:7; Imv. fs. [[פְּחִי]] Ez Eze 37:9; Inf. [[פַ֫חַת]]([[לָ]]) Ez Eze 22:20; Pf. act. [[נׁפֵחַ]] Is 54:16; pass. [[נׇפוּחַ]] Je 1:13, Job 41:12; —breathe, blow, [[וַיִּפַּח בְּאַפּוֹ נִשְׁמַת]] [[חַיִּים]] Ge 2:7 (J); sq. [[ב]] also Ez Eze 37:9, Is 54:16 and Hag 1:9 blow into it (to scatter it); sq. [[עַל־]]: [[לָפַחַת]] [[עָלָיו אֵשׁ]] Ez Eze 22:20 to blow fire upon it (ore, for melting), so fig. Ez Eze 22:21 and I will blow upon you with ([[ב]]) the fire of my wrath; [[נַפְשָׁהּ]] ´[[נ]] Je 15:9 she hath breathed out her life (of a mother, cf.

definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: ); abs. [[סִיר נׇפוּחַ]] Je 1:13 a blown (i.e. well-heated, boiling) pot, cf. ´[[דּוּד נ]] Job 41:12 (sim.).

definitions.title: Pu.
definitions.body: Pf. [[אֵשׁ לאׁ נֻפָָּח]] Job 20:26 a fire not blown (by any human breath). So perh. also Nu 21:30 (reading ´[[עַד־נֻפַּח אֵשׁ וגו]] until fire was blown [hot] as far as Medeba), cf. Di.

definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: Pf. 1 S. [[נֶפֶשׁ בְּעָלֶיהָ חִפָָּחְתִּי]] Job 31:39 (or if) the life of its (the land's) owners I have caused them to breathe out; [[וְהִפַּחְתֶּם אוֹתוֹ]] Mal 1:13 and ye have sniffed at it (in contempt).
